thread.title: Matt Lauer wore a choker necklace and nothing will ever be the same
thread.title_full: Matt Lauer wore a choker necklace and nothing will ever be the same - TODAY.com

author: Embry Roberts
title: Matt Lauer wore a choker necklace and nothing will ever be the same
text:
First, they came for our skinny jeans. Then, they came for our topknots. And now … they’re coming for our jewelry.
That’s right, male choker necklaces are officially a thing.
 Chokers for men are a thing too -- and Matt Lauer is braving the trend Play Video - 1:10 Chokers for men are a thing too -- and Matt Lauer is braving the trend Play Video - 1:10 More video 1:26 See Amazon’s 'flying warehouse' patent, a ‘mothership’ for drone delivery 1:19 Dad presses charges after daughter uses credit card on ticket to see boy (in Germany!) 1:35 Watch Paul Ryan’s unamused reaction to teen ‘dabbing’ at Senate swear-in 0:51 Al Roker freaking out over surfing dogs was the best thing at the Rose Parade RELATED: Is a man bun ever OK?
And we don’t just mean bad-boy-sexy studded collars …
Getty Images Runway ready, or "run away" ready? You decide. ... or minimalist black bands, á la Ryan Atwood in "The O.C."
I AM SCREAMING at this text in response to @ASOS carrying male chokers pic.twitter.com/yhEXsUhZYi
— ERNEST-O (@emacys) January 3, 2017 These, um, these, well …
They come in pink velvet .
us.asos.com A pink velvet choker says, "I'm tough, but also sensitive." We guess. And braided leather .
us.asos.com Does braided leather make it any better? We're not so sure. And deep V-neck ready cuts .
us.asos.com This gives new meaning to the deep V-neck craze. Gentlemen, if you're making that distraught emoji face , we urge you to see this as an opportunity to prove your fashion sense. After all, if you can pull off this, you can pull off anything.
Just ask TODAY's own Matt Lauer, who bravely took the trend for a spin on Wednesday.
TODAY After some initial skepticism, he seemed to view it as an upgrade to the dickies he wore back in the day. And can we just say: Matt, you've never looked more hip.
RELATED: Glitter beards are the latest trend for men — yes, really
But if you're still not sold, take it up with *NSYNC. Because as usual, we can trace the blame (at least partly) back to the '90s.
KMazur / WireImage JT, JC and Joey have been hot to this trend for years. Justin, is that turquoise? Wave "bye bye bye" if you need help.
